report_title: Industry at a Glance: Electronic and Computer Repair Services
executive_summary: The electronic and computer repair services industry includes repairing and maintaining consumer electronic equipment, computers, office machines, communications equipment and other electronic equipment. Industry performance generally runs countercyclical to poor economic conditions, as consumers substitute purchases with repairs during periods of economic uncertainty. Revenue declined over 2019-2024 due to low unemployment and high income supporting new device purchases versus repairs. Despite the pandemic, business closures and stay-at-home orders deepened demand declines in 2020 as consumers deferred repairs.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Industry Performance is Countercyclical to Economic Performance
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Strong economic conditions over most of the past five years have contributed to recent revenue declines. Electronic and computer repair services are one of a few industries with potential to weather weak economic conditions, especially compared with other industries in the electronics subsector.
Supply chain disruptions contributed to increased demand for repairs in 2022.

Heightened usage of electronics should increase the rate at which they need repairs, but technical advancements have elongated the life cycle of these goods while rapid obsoletion of technology has provided further incentive for consumers to replace old equipment, constraining revenue.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Industry Operators Will Find New Areas of Demand
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Operators will find sustained demand via the increasing complexity of consumer devices, computers and other precision instruments that require certain complex repair services.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Accelerated Technological Change Will Drive Replacements Over Repair
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The choice between replacing and repairing equipment will continue to be the most significant demand determinant for this industry.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: New Product Introductions and Consumer Demand for the Latest Models Will Constrain Growth
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Falling prices will grow demand for new electronic goods, providing a stronger incentive for consumers to replace rather than repair products.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Decreasing Demand Will Cause Smaller Operators to Struggle
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The number of electrical and electronic installers and repairers will continue to decline as operators contend with falling demand.
